p: Our main findings were an overall lifetime synthetic drug use prevalence of 39.8% among the 3,156 MSM surveyed across 16 cities in China. Synthetic drug users were more likely to be young, single, and better educated, and were more likely to engage in higher risk sexual behavior compared to non-users. HIV prevalence among synthetic drug users was 10.6%, well above that of non-users (6.0%), and odds of HIV-positive serostatus was 2-fold higher among synthetic drug users, compared to non-users.
